questions.q: The thing that precedes 'bar'
The thing that follows 'foo'
This is the term for a sequence of 4 bits, which can represent values from 0 to 15 in hexadecimal notation.
Java's magic word. Every class file starts with these 8 bytes.
The measure of the speed of data transmission in a communication channel. Specifically, it refers to the number of signal changes or symbols transmitted per second.
This co-founder of Microsoft is known for his role in revolutionizing personal computing and is one of the wealthiest individuals in the world.
This influential figure in the world of programming is known for developing the Python programming language, which emphasizes code readability and simplicity.

questions.q: Often referred to as the father of the computer, he designed the Analytical Engine, a mechanical general-purpose computer, in the 1830s.
This pioneering computer scientist and U.S. Navy rear admiral is known for her work on the development of COBOL, one of the first high-level programming languages.
This Belgian computer scientist collaborated with Tim Berners-Lee at CERN to help develop the World Wide Web and is known for advocating its accessibility and use.
A design principle for separating a computer program into distinct sections, each addressing a separate concern.
questions.a: What is SoC / separation of concerns?

questions.q: This acronym represents a set of five design principles in object-oriented programming aimed at making software designs more understandable, flexible, and maintainable.
The principle which states that a class should have only one reason to change
questions.a: What is SRP / single responsibility principle?

questions.q: A process of creating a design of software where the design matches the output
A group of web development techniques to let you create asynchronous applications, specifically in the Browser
The programming language developed by Apple for iOS and macOS app development, introduced in 2014?
This language, designed for statistical computing and graphics, is widely used among statisticians and data miners.
This language, primarily used for system programming, is known for its performance and memory safety features, and was created by Mozilla.
This programming language, developed in the early 1970s by Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie, served as a precursor to C and was designed for system programming and language implementation.
Developed in the 1950s, this high-level programming language is known for its use in scientific and engineering applications and is one of the oldest programming languages still in use today.
This command is used to display the contents of a text file in the terminal, allowing you to read it one screen at a time.
This humorous command, often used as a playful response to mistyping ls, displays an animation of a steam locomotive moving across the terminal screen.
This command is used to display the contents of a file in reverse order, showing the last line first.
The rev utility copies the specified files to the standard output, reversing the order of characters in every line
